meanings.definition: Cause to feel self-conscious or ashamed.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally embarrassed myself by tripping in front of everyone.
meanings.sent2: She didn't mean to embarrass him by revealing his secret.
meanings.sent3: The cat embarrassed itself by getting stuck in a paper bag.
meanings.sent4: His loud singing embarrassed the shy girl like a spotlight on a stage.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's kind words helped the student avoid feeling embarrassed in class.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel awkward or uncomfortable.
meanings.sent1: Please don't embarrass me by bringing up that old story.
meanings.sent2: He tried not to embarrass his friend during the speech.
meanings.sent3: The clown's silly antics embarrassed the serious magician.
meanings.sent4: The bright spotlight on stage embarrassed the nervous actor.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected question embarrassed her in front of the whole class.

meanings.sent1: The heavy rain embarrassed our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent2: The traffic jam embarrassed their journey to the airport.
meanings.sent3: The broken elevator embarrassed their quick escape from the building.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog embarrassed their visibility on the road.
meanings.sent5: The lack of resources embarrassed their progress on the project.
